channel.title: CVE Feed for emrevona -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for emrevona -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-1919|2024-08-02T06:05:26.809Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_preload_single_save_settings_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change cache-related settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1925|2024-08-02T06:05:26.765Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_clear_cache_of_allsites_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to clear caches via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1920|2024-08-02T06:05:27.053Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_purgecache_varnish_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to purge the varnish cache via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1929|2024-08-02T06:05:26.690Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data modification due to a missing capability check on the wpfc_purgecache_varnish_callback function in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to purge the varnish cache.

item.title: CVE-2023-1921|2024-08-02T06:05:26.997Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_start_cdn_integration_ajax_request_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change cdn settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1928|2024-08-02T06:05:26.693Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data modification due to a missing capability check on the wpfc_preload_single_callback function in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to initiate cache creation.

item.title: CVE-2023-1926|2024-08-02T06:05:26.666Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the deleteCacheToolbar function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to perform cache deletion via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1922|2024-08-02T06:05:26.955Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_pause_cdn_integration_ajax_request_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change cdn settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1375|2024-08-02T05:49:10.352Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized cache deletion in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2 due to a missing capability check in the deleteCacheToolbar function . This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level permissions and above, to delete the site's cache.

item.title: CVE-2023-1930|2024-08-02T06:05:26.787Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data deletion due to a missing capability check on the wpfc_clear_cache_of_allsites_callback function in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to delete caches.

item.title: CVE-2023-1924|2024-08-02T06:05:26.498Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_toolbar_save_settings_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change cache settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1923|2024-08-02T06:05:26.678Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_remove_cdn_integration_ajax_request_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change cdn settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1918|2024-08-02T06:05:27.061Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the wpfc_preload_single_callback function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to invoke a cache building action via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1927|2024-08-02T06:05:26.739Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the deleteCssAndJsCacheToolbar function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to perform cache deletion via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-1931|2024-08-02T06:05:26.901Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized data loss due to a missing capability check on the deleteCssAndJsCacheToolbar function in versions up to, and including, 1.1.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber-level access to perform cache deletion.

item.title: CVE-2024-4347|2024-08-01T20:40:46.511Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Directory Traversal in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.6 via the specificDeleteCache function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers to delete arbitrary files on the server, which can include wp-config.php files of the affected site or other sites in a shared hosting environment.

item.title: CVE-2024-4347|2024-06-04T17:53:52.105Z -- emrevona -- wp%20fastest%20cache
item.description: The WP Fastest Cache plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Directory Traversal in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.6 via the specificDeleteCache function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers to delete arbitrary files on the server, which can include wp-config.php files of the affected site or other sites in a shared hosting environment.
